page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: {Roads:Melton Mowbray's roads are quite {congested. To help the congestion, a {one way system was introduced some {years ago. An inner relief road was {opened in the summer of 1985 has {allowed the traffic to flow more {smoothly. It has also allowed part of {the town centre to be pedestrianised. { {Railways:Until 1953 Melton Mowbray had {three railways lines and two railway {stations. Now there is only one {station and one railway line which {runs from Peterborough to Birmingham {via Stamford, Oakham, Melton Mowbray, {Leicester and Nuneaton. { {Buses:Melton Mowbray is served by {three bus companies:Midland Red, {Lincolnshire Road Car and Bartons. }
